channel.title: How to add JFrame to client
channel.description: Alright time to spoon feed me because I tried EVERYTHING I could possibly think of... I just need to be spoonfed how to get a window box up that allows you to type in text... PLEASE HELP!! And I want it to load when you press the HOME button.. which is already declared.

item.title: How to add JFrame to client
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

Well you need to trigger the jframe.

Read full topic

item.title: How to add JFrame to client
item.dc:creator: @RSCLives RSCLives
item.description:
@RSCLives wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:4, topic:358752”] JFrame frame = new JFrame("I'm RSCLives and I'm a stupid fuck"); frame.setSize(500, 500); frame.setVisible(true); [/quote] haha wow… nub I got it to work and I aint stupid.

frame.setSize(500, 500);
frame.setVisible(true);
